H0.text: What geological period, named after an English county, was 416-360 million years ago. Devonian

H1.text: What geological period, named after an English county, was 416-360 million years ago. Cornubian

H2.text: What geological period, named after an English county, was 416-360 million years ago. Dorsetian

H3.text: What geological period, named after an English county, was 416-360 million years ago. Emsian

A4.text: The period is named after Devon, a county in southwestern England, where a controversial argument in the 1830s over the age and structure of the rocks found throughout the county was resolved by adding the Devonian Period to the geological timescale.

A5.text: It is named after Devon, South West England, where rocks from this period were first studied.
